author: Ralph
title: Russia central bank says may switch to neutral monetary policy by year-end
text: March 16, 2018 / 10:05 AM / in a day Russia central bank says may switch to neutral monetary policy by year-end Reuters Staff 1 Min Read MOSCOW (Reuters) - The Russian central bank said on Friday it could switch to a neutral monetary policy by the end of the year, sending a signal that it may cut rates quicker than expected. A view shows the Russia's Central Bank headquarters in Moscow, Russia February 22, 2018. REUTERS/Sergei Karpukhin The central bank, which is widely expected to trim its key rate from 7.5 percent at a board meeting next Friday, said inflationary risks have declined as annual inflation slowed to an all-time low of 2.18 percent in February. In a regular report on market trends, the central bank also warned that so-called “trade wars” pose risks to global economic growth and the stability of financial markets. Reporting by Andrey Ostroukh; Editing by Jack Stubbs
